text: Post-translational modification of NF-kappaB heterodimers such as phosphorylation or acetylation also contributes to its transcriptional activity [ 41 ] , [ 42 ] , [ 43 ] .

Because NF-kappaB constitutively translocates to the nucleus in monocytic lineage [ 13 ] and activates gene transcription and survival in murine macrophages [ 11 ] , we sought to determine how M-CSF affected NF-kappaB transcriptional activity in human MDMs and whether this activation regulated their survival .

The present study demonstrated that M-CSF stimulated <extra_id_0> PKCalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase upstream of NF-kappaB transcriptional activity in primary human MDMs and RAW 264.7 cells .

We showed inhibition of conventional PKCs by PKC inhibitors , kinase deficient <extra_id_0> PKCalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> PKCalpha siRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocked M-CSF - induced cell survival and NF-kappaB - regulated gene expression .
This block correlated with a reduction in M-CSF - induced phosphorylation of NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at Ser276 .
